intro: Brunellia cayambensis, commonly known as Cayamba or Cayambilla, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded canopy and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
